page.title: 03 Housing in Lamberhurst
page.content: The{Housing}in this village shows great diversity in age and styles of architecture. { The Charity}on School Hill is an example of Wealden Hall House, built in four bays between 1480 and 1550 with the centre chimney added later in the 16th century. The structural timber framing is exposed on the front and side elevations. The northern jettied end was the family living area with a dragon_beamed ceiling. The hall was in the centre two bays with the domestic quarters to the south. In 1648 it became the parish workhouse and in later years the cellar was used as the lock_up, the iron bars still being evident in the side street. Three families live there now. The{Conservation Area}includes the interesting Coggers Hall and Cottages.
